trigonometric: Of or relating to the principles of trigonometry
angle: The space between two lines or planes that intersect
adjacent: Having a common boundary or edge
radian: The unit of plane angle equal to the angle at the center of a circle subtended by an arc equal in length to the radius
unit circle: A circle with a radius of 1
sine: The ratio of the length of the side opposite the given angle to the length of the hypotenuse of a right-angled triangle
cosine: The ratio of the adjacent side to the hypotenuse of a right-angled triangle
tangent: A line that touches a curve at only one point
secant: A straight line that intersects a curve at two or more points
pythagorean theorem: A fundamental relation in Euclidean geometry between the three sides of a right triangle
periodic function: A function that repeats its values at regular intervals or periods
amplitude: The maximum displacement or distance moved by a point on a vibrating body or wave
degree measure: The measure of an angle in degrees, where a full circle is divided into 360 degrees
